text: Hi guys can anyone let me know how to eliminate the test mailids from the contacts or from email stats.
And a automated way to transfer the contact data into the xl sheet.
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> I'm building an integration with another platform that sends SMS. Through that Iframe, I want to open another page where the user types the SMS message and send it to those contacts
Guys, how can i create an option like this one inside the `more`  dropdown on Contact list?
Very cool
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PDRW72/p1670524667319099>
Very interested in hearing more about your use case. Can you setup a short call with us to go through it in detail? <https://meetings.HubSpot.com/sparikh1>

It's already working using CRM Cards, but with that I can send only a single message to that specific contact.
By creating a new option outside the contact details page, I will be able to message multiple contacts at once.
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> done!

<@U04BBKKQ7D3> you are bringing a couple of interesting use cases, that helps us understand where the gaps are. I sent my meeting link to you in another thread above, let’s have a call and talk about both of these that you posted.
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> I scheduled 15min with you.

:rotating_light: *Private Beta Alert: CRM record page reporting & property cards* :rotating_light:

Hello! I am a Product Manager at HubSpot and work on the CRM record pages :wave:
We now have two new components available to use when creating a *<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-custom-crm-cards-with-projects|custom CRM card>* to display on a record page. This beta builds on the existing *Extend HubSpot’s UI with Developer Tools* beta and allows you to display cards with editable properties and HubSpot reports.

If you are interested in participating in this beta, send me a DM and we can get started!
Thanks!
Nice, some pretty cool stuff here

Hey guys, I'm trying to build a custom crm card with projects where user will be able to update a deal after filling the form.
I'm getting a timeout error after subimitting the form and sending update request via crm.deals.basicApi.update.
Is there anyone who faced the same problem?
Part of the code responsible for the call:
Is there any more to the function? possibly something that would cause it to execute for longer than the allotted 5 seconds?
No, there is only 1 test deal, with the id I hardcoded there for a test
I added axios and added a dummy call before hs api call and axiod part works fine, still hanging on hs api:
What happens if you make the update call entirely with axios instead of the client
It shouldn't have more then a couple of milliseconds impact but might be worth testing
yeah, let me check that
Hmmm, I'm getting 400 Bad Request
But it might be my fault, strted with JS this week :wink:
Did you send it as a patch request
yes
tried sending both properties and simplePublicObjectInput
I guess it has to be my fault but it's 2:30 AM here and I believe it will be best if I come back to it in the morning :wink:
<@U01QVR44MEY> - all hints are welcome of course :slightly_smiling_face:
I really like using postman to generate call that I'm not sure of one moment
Let me know if it works

Came back, it was bothering me :wink:
And I actually found the problem:
```{"status":"error","message":"Property values were not valid: [{\"isValid\":false,\"message\":\"yes was not one of the allowed options: [label: \\\"Yes\\\"\\nvalue: \\\"true\\\"```
One of the fields is a dropdown and I was passing yes/no instead of true/false
after fixing that it works fine via axios
Tried with HubSpotClient.crm.deals.basicApi.update again but fixing the true/false problem doesn't help here
Still getting the timeout after 5 seconds :confused:
Dang that's a bummer good to know that you can atleast get it working using axios
